Pass Off.definition: to make public or offer for sale
Pass Off.origin: [ passing his product off as that of the plaintiff's "W. L. Prosser and W. P. Keeton"]

1.definition: to make public or offer for sale (goods or services) with intent to deceive[his productas that of the plaintiff's "W. L. Prosser and W. P. Keeton"] see also
1.off: as that of the plaintiff's "W. L. Prosser and W. P. Keeton"] see also

2.definition: to give a false identity or character to [they created the documents on the day of the trial andthemas being made earlier]
